title: Can We Get Brand Out Of Botlane
body:
Honestly it's just getting tiresome now. 

He's incredibly strong as a support when used right. There's no way to fight a good Brand support except stay under turret and hope your jungler comes to gank.

Oh but if that happens Brand will just press R, facesmash his other keys, and walk away as you wait for your passive countdown to explode and finish you off. 


Either tone him down or find a way to send him back midlane because he's way too strong as a botlane support and it's just getting annoying. 

I'd rather see Xerath, Veigar, literally any other midlaner botlane than Brand.


Instead of making Brand desirable, send him back to his original lane and make unpopular zoning supports like Zyra or Zilean desirable. They honestly feel better to play against than Brand even if I'm dodging plants and bombs every other second. They don't do nearly as much as 1 single Brand ability early game.

Or at the very least with that change support brand has poke more aligned with other supports damage wise with his stun being what separates actual good brands and brands facerolling keys.

I'm not overly worried about Brand's stun in particular. Yeah, it's there, but other champs have better CC options (looking at you, Morgana). Brand's issue is that the stun is usually set up by an unmissable E, then followed up with a W that you won't be able to dodge. EQW followed by passive detonation is a stupidly massive amount of damage early on that Brand realistically only has to land one skillshot for.
Agreed, first obvious thing to do imo is lower his free passive %hp damage to 3% instead of 4%.

There are many champion in this case. Like Master Yi, Annie, Garen and mores... The problem is their kit is so basic it can't work in all elo. To do so, they require complex rework and the champion will no longer feel the same champion. While it's not a problem with champion like Yorick, unlike Yorick, these champion have a considerable player base.

One big problem with Brand on lower elo is people stick together for his Aoe, his kit is entirely about damage, dots and aoe are meant to do the most total damage in a game giving him very strong punish on people mistake.
I can confirm, you need to be very careful about your positionning. Not unplayable tho, but you sure need to be much better than Alistar.

Brand has no real mobility or sustain, or even tankiness. Hes also very item dependent.

Meaning if you kill him in lane a few times, hes going to fall off a cliff.

Brand is susceptible to poke lanes and all in lanes early. His only CC is fairly difficult to land, and his harass is very mana hungry.

1) Who's going to poke the Brand? Normal supports won't do much to him (too much risk, no reward), and ADC's are busy CSing + avoiding his W.

2) The only way you're going to kill Brand without suffering deaths is with Lulu. General supports who don't deal damage won't match the damage output Brand adds to his side.

3) Mana hungry harass doesn't matter, because that's all Brand's abilities do. It's not like he can heal or shield instead. You only win here when your ADC can maintain CS, while successfully avoiding Brand's W, and avoiding enemy ADC pokes. That's a lot of things to juggle.

Ezreal, Cait, Ashe etc all have the ability to poke brand before brand is even in range to do literally anything to them. Brand has no real kill potential unless he opens E, and his W spam for damage will run him OOM in like 3 casts.

Thresh, blitz, leona, hell, literally any all in support will dominate brand, because brand has no mobility and is really squishy. Brands pre 6 is really meh, and if he cant land his Q, he cant kill you. 

He is a kill support who needs kills early. Yes, his abilities deal damage, and he should deal good damage. That doesnt mean you need to run scared from him constantly. His biggest spikes are level 3 and 6 in lane. Brand will melt to any form of engage that lands on him regardless.

Brand is only good when cant you position well. His W is extremely telegraphed and q is easily dodgeable.
He pretty much does no damage if you can sidestep well.
You should only complain if you are not playing ranged adc bot and sp.
But he zones out melee champs super well with little effort, but sucks against hard engage melee sp.

The power that Brand has is his incredible base damage, which is entirely his passive. Blaze has no AP scaling, it has no per level scaling, it is powerful from level 1 on. But it needs to be that strong to keep him functioning in mid. Not much you can do about it other than give bot laners more MR, which would hurt Sona and Lulu more than Brand.
Blaze has ap and level scaling.

I think it would be healthier if Brand were tuned in such a way that...
every time he goes Bot lane, he has to take the role of an ADC, rather than a support.


for that to happen, you could...

* reduce base damage and increase ratios.
* give him a seiging mechanic, that is entirely gold based (maybe his passive has zero base damage, scales with AP, and now hits turrets, even if the main effect of his spells doesn't effect them)
